title: HelliumZ
author: HelliumZ
created_time: October 31, 2023, 05:23:33 AMLast edit: October 31, 2023, 07:24:46 AM by HelliumZ
content: Looks like 15 years of Bitcoin have passed. Today is the historic October 31st day in 2008 when Satoshi Nakamoto published his Bitcoin WhitePaper. This 9 page white paper is still with us today and this white paper is the first document of Bitcoin. This whitepaper is currently translated into more than 40 languages.

comments.author: Catenaccio
comments.body: Today is a 15th birthday of Bitcoin Whitepaper Release!It was published at metzdown.com on this day, in 2008.Bitcoin P2P e-cash paper at metzdown.comBitcoin 2008/09-2022 History Paperback/Hardcover BookBitcoin history Book. Download its draft versionBitcoin White paper is archived at Satoshi Nakamoto Institute

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Fucking hell it feels like we were just talking about the 10th year anniversary last year; like I thought this year was just supposed to be its 11th or 12th birthday. Gahddamn.Anyway, I'm pouring a glass tonight for this tech that caused to be really interested in money/finance.

comments.author: Majestic-milf
comments.body: Sheesh! It's 15 years already! How time flies! It looks like only yesterday when Satoshi was trying to publish the white paper.¬† This is a day worth celebrating in the history of Bitcoin as it has managed to beat all odds and thrived. Prior to Bitcoin, there has been several attempts at creating digital currencies like eCash, BitGold and HashCash but none of them saw the light of day like Bitcoin has done. No matter how much criticism and backlash it has received, it still is the highest valued digital currency to be created and as if he(Satoshi) knew that one day fiat will be in great trouble. Atleast we have him to thank for his foresight.¬†The Bitcoin white paper with it's 9 pages, twelve section long document is so detailed that I feel that financial institutions could borrow a leaf from the wealth of knowledge Satoshi Nakamoto poured into it.¬†Well, let's raise a glass to this!üçª

comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: It's been 15 years since the white paper was published I mean the white paper was really published in the aftermath of the financial crisis and offered all kinds of solutions to problems of that era, which persist even today. It is just beautiful to see that 15 years later bitcoin has come to fruition and it has offered a solution for the people who need it the most and governments and regulators are paying attention to it and we are using it for transactions.

comments.author: Blitzboy
comments.body: It wasnt just words; it was a plan for change and a rallying cry to rethink our old banking systems. And look at where we are now. This unique whitepaper can be read in more than 40 languages. Its effect, reach, and resonance are undeniable and huge.But there's an important problem that we need to face head-on: Are we making sure that the spirit of Bitcoin stays pure over the years? Or are we getting off track because of quick wins and flashy things? Nakamoto's ideas were complicated, deep, and multilayered. Right now, every Bitcoin fan and crypto investor needs to dig deep, ask questions, and think about what they're doing. Are we going in the right direction, or are we just skimming the surface?

comments.author: thecodebear
comments.body: Happy 15!!While this makes me feel like Bitcoin is now longer a brand new thing, conversely it also makes me realize how young Bitcoin is. A global currency, only 15 years old! Bitcoin is maybe out of its infancy, but its still a toddler working on learning to walk.I think in another 15 years we will be talking about Bitcoin starting to reach adolescence and finally starting to be used transactionally by people.Here's to the next 15 years of the world's best ever currency and what will go down as one of the most startling inventions of the 21st century!

comments.author: Mpamaegbu
comments.body: A decade and a half of tremendous goodness, indeed! The rate at which Bitcoin developed is really astonishing to the point that one would think it was created some three decades or more ago. Satoshi, (whoever that dude is (are), deserves a mention as one of the most influential people of this century.Yes, I know the aim of the P2P angle to Bitcoin as captured on the document's first page is valued less than the asset part of it today. I guess the latter part is even what has drawn more people to Bitcoin than the payment option and P2P part. All the same, it's still a win-win for Bitcoin and we celebrate Satoshi for all that.
